name: Healthcare & Life Sciences
description: Improving human health through medical care, research, and innovative healthcare technologies.

subRoles.name: Medical Doctor
subRoles.shortDescription: Diagnoses and treats patients to maintain and restore health.
subRoles.longDescription: Medical doctors examine patients, take medical histories, diagnose illnesses and injuries, and prescribe medications or treatments. They work in various specialties from general practice to highly specialized fields like neurosurgery or cardiology.

typicalDay: Diagnose new patients and review test results

subRoles.potential: Noble profession with job security and respect in society. Specializations offer diverse career paths.

education.minimum: MBBS degree from recognized medical college

subRoles.name: Biomedical Researcher
subRoles.shortDescription: Conducts research to advance medical science and develop new treatments.
subRoles.longDescription: Biomedical researchers design and conduct experiments to understand diseases, develop new drugs, and improve medical treatments. They work in laboratories, universities, pharmaceutical companies, and research institutions.

subRoles.name: Healthcare Technology Specialist
subRoles.shortDescription: Develops and implements technology solutions for healthcare delivery.
subRoles.longDescription: Healthcare technology specialists bridge the gap between healthcare and technology. They develop medical software, implement electronic health records, and work on telemedicine platforms.
